text: Xabier Etxeita Gorritxategi (; ; born 31 October 1987) is a Spanish professional footballer who plays for Getafe CF mainly as a centre back. ==Club career== Born in Amorebieta-Etxano, Biscay, Etxeita finished his development within Athletic Bilbao's prolific youth academy at Lezama, after playing with hometown club SD Amorebieta. His first three games with the first team of the former, all in 2008–09's La Liga, were not without incidents: in his first, a 2–0 home win against neighbours CA Osasuna on 16 November 2008,Athletic 2 – Osasuna 0; Athletic Bilbao, 16 November 2008 he subbed in for injured Ustaritz, being sent off in the following against CD Numancia (same venue and result).Athletic 2 – Numancia 0; Athletic Bilbao, 30 November 2008 On 21 December, he replaced Ander Murillo who also retired before half- time due to injury, in a 1–0 success at Real Betis;Betis 0 – Athletic 1; Athletic Bilbao, 21 December 2008 during the season, however, he was mainly registered with the B-side. In the very last days of the 2010 January transfer window, Etxeita moved on a five-month loan to FC Cartagena in the second division.El cierra la cesión de Etxeita (Cartagena close Etxeita loan); Marca, 26 January 2010 On 16 July 2010 he left Athletic and signed with another club in that level, Elche CF, quickly going on to establish himself in the starting XI. On 4 June 2013, after contributing with 40 games and four goals3–1: El Elche completa pleno de triunfos ante un rival que no inquietó (3–1: Elche go three for three against unassuming rival); Mundo Deportivo, 1 September 2012 El Elche ratifica su liderato tras ganar al Almería (1–0) (Elche confirm first place after beating Almería (1–0)); El Mundo, 16 December 2012 La estrategia del líder destroza al Sabadell (Leaders' strategy rips Sabadell apart); Marca, 6 January 2013 El líder se estrella en la mano de Máyor (Leaders crash against Máyor's hand); Marca, 20 January 2013 as the Valencian Community team returned to the top level after more than 20 years, Etxeita returned to Athletic Bilbao on a free transfer.El Elche confirma que Etxeita regresa al Athletic (Elche confirm Etxeita returns to Athletic); Deia, 4 June 2013 He only made his official debut on 7 April of the following year,Etxeita sale a escena ocho meses después (Etxeita jumps the stage eight months later); Marca, 6 April 2014 featuring the full 90 minutes in a 2–1 away win over Levante UD.Bilbao strengthen grip on top four; ESPN FC, 7 April 2014 Etxeita scored his first competitive goal for Athletic on 25 October 2014, netting the only in a league fixture at UD Almería.Etxeita da aire al Athletic (Etxeita lets Athletic breathe); Marca, 25 October 2014 His second came on 4 March of the following year, as he helped to a 2–0 win over RCD Espanyol in Barcelona to make his team reach the final of the Copa del Rey for the first time in three years;Como manda la tradición (Will of tradition); Marca, 4 March 2015 he played the entire decisive match, a 1–3 defeat to FC Barcelona, and also started both legs of the subsequent edition of the Supercopa de España against the same opponent, which was won 5–1 on aggregate and brought a first trophy for the player. On 24 July 2018, Exteita was loaned to fellow top division side SD Huesca for one year. In August 2019, the free agent left the San Mamés Stadium and signed a two-year contract with Getafe CF of the same tier. ==International career== Etxeita received his first call up to the senior Spain team in October 2015. He earned his first cap on the 12th, featuring the full 90 minutes in a 1–0 win in Ukraine – the last round, the nation had already secured the first position in its group – for the UEFA Euro 2016 qualifiers. He also featured for the unofficial Basque Country regional side. ==Honours== Athletic Bilbao *Supercopa de España: 2015 ==References== ==External links== * * * * Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:People from Amorebieta-Etxano Category:Spanish footballers Category:Basque footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:La Liga players Category:Segunda División players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:SD Amorebieta footballers Category:Bilbao Athletic footballers Category:Athletic Bilbao footballers Category:FC Cartagena footballers Category:Elche CF players Category:SD Huesca footballers Category:Getafe CF footballers Category:Spain international footballers Category:Basque Country international footballers
title: Xabier Etxeita
